chargeHist.descr: Felon in Possession of an Oleoresin Device

result.execSummary:
The defendant Morgan A. Moreno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Felon in Possession of an Oleoresin Device [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.26(4)(L).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**1 day credit if probation revoked.**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Morgan A. Moreno

records.addlTxt: Probation Revoked - Sentenced to Prison on 09/19/2022

2:01 PM cases 21CF474 and 22CF268 called. Defendant Morgan A. Moreno in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis S. Gaetz in court for Morgan A. Moreno.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have a joint recommendation which the State recites. Defense summarizes reasoning for the joint recommendation. Court summarizes the counts to which the defendant has been revoked. 
As to counts 1 and 3 in 22CF268: Court orders 12 months in jail on each count to run concurrent to one another and any other sentence currently being served. 
As to count 1 in 21CF474:  Court orders 12 months in jail to run concurrent to any other sentence currently being served. 
All costs are reduced to a civil judgment. 
In 22CF268: 89 days credit. In 21CF474: 118 days credit.
Amended to reflect Count 3 is 1 year probation length.
Order approving to amend Judgment of Conviction to reflect a probation term of one year.
Dated 09/01/2022, Letter from ADA Gunderson to Court regarding review of Judgment of Conviction.
Dated 08/31/2022, Letter from Court to ADA Gunderson regarding review of Judgment of Conviction.
Dated 08/31/2022, Letter from Corrections Sentencing Associate Advanced Maggie Hutchens to Court requesting a review of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Revocation Warrant, Order, and Packet on Counts 1 and 3
Revocation Warrant, Order, and Packet on Counts 1 and 3
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights with attachment
Reminder Notice indicating amount due handed directly to the defendant with DNA form as the defendant has no address on file.

(9:59 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Morgan A. Moreno in court. Attorney James H Krave in court for Morgan A. Moreno.
Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Prior offenses for repeater enhancers acknowledged.
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine as Repeater and Count 3: Felon in Possession of an Oleoresin Device as Repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's Guilty pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1 and Count 3.
Defendant makes a statement.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:
60 days jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court on Count 1. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with any known drug dealers/users, except in a therapeutic setting. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs.  1 day credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
Court orders the phone in evidence may be returned to the defendant once it is no longer of evidentiary value.
Arraignment on June 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(Case called at 11:08 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Morgan Moreno appears in custody via video conference from the Lincoln County Jail without counsel. ADA Matthew Kirkpatrick appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant executed. State requests $2,000 cash bond- recites failures to appear. Defendant requests signature bond. Court orders $2,500 signature bond with previously ordered conditions. 
Arraignment: 06/14/2022 at 10:00 AM (Branch 2).

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
Return on warrant on May 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Return on warrant on May 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 10:18 AM.
Defendant Morgan A. Moreno not in court.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Morgan A. Moreno.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Krave has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance and notes there is an active out of state (Minnesota) warrant for her.
Court notes there are no prior non-appearances. State requests warrant due to the outstanding warrant in Minnesota.
Warrant ordered.
Same as Complaint.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2022 at 10:15 am.

(Case called at 9:53 AM- by Zoom) Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Morgan A. Moreno appeared by video.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Morgan A. Moreno. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Defendant updates address.
Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 2 Judicial Assistant.
